description: The year of the Exodus, when the Israelites left Egypt under Moses' leadership.
The year King Solomon began building the First Temple in Jerusalem.
The year the Kingdom of Israel was divided into the northern kingdom (Israel) and southern kingdom (Judah).
The year the Babylonian exile began after the fall of Jerusalem.
The year Cyrus the Great issued a decree allowing the Jews to return to Jerusalem.
The year Nehemiah completed the rebuilding of the walls of Jerusalem.
The birth year of Jesus Christ, traditionally marked as the start of the Christian calendar.
The year of the crucifixion and resurrection of Jesus Christ.
The year Paul began his missionary journeys.
The year the Temple in Jerusalem was destroyed by the Romans.
The year the Dead Sea Scrolls were discovered, providing insight into Jewish and early Christian life.
The year the state of Israel was established, fulfilling biblical prophecy for many Christians.
The year King Hezekiah completed preparations to protect Jerusalem from Assyrian siege, including the Siloam Tunnel.
The year Josiah began his reforms and rediscovered the Book of the Law in the Temple.
The year Ezekiel began his prophetic ministry among the exiles in Babylon.
The year of the rebuilding of the Second Temple in Jerusalem under Zerubbabel's leadership.
The year Malachi delivered his prophetic message, marking the close of Old Testament prophecy.
The year the Magi visited the young Jesus, guided by the star of Bethlehem.
The year of the Apostle Peter's leadership at the Jerusalem Council, addressing Gentile inclusion in the church.
The year the Apostle John received the Revelation on the island of Patmos.
The year Elijah was taken to heaven in a chariot of fire.
The year Jonah preached repentance to the city of Nineveh.
The year Isaiah prophesied the birth of the Messiah.
The year Daniel interpreted Nebuchadnezzar's dream of the great statue.
The year Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego were saved from the fiery furnace.
The year Belshazzar saw the handwriting on the wall, marking the fall of Babylon.
The year the ark of the covenant was captured by the Philistines during the time of Samuel.
The year Ruth married Boaz, continuing the lineage to King David.
The year David was anointed king by the prophet Samuel.
The year Solomon completed the construction of the First Temple.
The year the prophet Jeremiah lamented the destruction of Jerusalem.
The year Ezra led a group of exiles back to Jerusalem to restore the law.
